results.title: Technical Project Manager
results.description:
Technical Project Manager

Notable’s mission is to enrich every patient interaction through modern digital experiences and eliminate the administrative burden on healthcare professionals using intelligent automation. By automating the complexities underlying the healthcare system, patients are empowered to gain greater access to the services they need through a streamlined experience while healthcare professionals can focus on providing the best care possible. Notable’s platform unifies artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, design, and no-code configurability to automate these workflows across the continuum of care - improving patient outcomes, while reducing costs. Leading healthcare organizations like CommonSpirit Health and Intermountain rely on our platform to provide a delightful omni-channel experience, deliver care at scale, reduce clinician documentation burden, and drive efficiency.

As a Technical Project Manager at Notable, you will be responsible for partnering with the engineering, security, and operations teams to drive key business initiatives forward. You will help manage the quality and release process, develop project plans and timelines for complex engineering projects, develop processes to track and prioritize engineering tech debt, and additional cross-functional projects. 

Day to day responsibilities:

You will…

  • own execution for upcoming features and projects, driving roadmap, specifications, and delivery

  • identify, assess and mitigate risks, provide visibility to management, anticipate and make trade-offs balancing the business needs versus constraints

  • scope projects into manageable chunks that enable us to release iterative products quickly and efficiently

  • act as main communication liaison with disparate internal stakeholders across engineering, product, and customer delivery teams

  • collaborate with the engineering team and product managers to evolve the team roadmap to align with the overall company roadmap, identifying necessary investments and dependencies to support execution and delivery

  • continue to improve our program management process, communication protocols, and operational procedures related to effective, on-time and to-scope software delivery

You’re a great fit because you…

  • have a minimum of 2 years of Technical Project Management experience

  • are proficient at leading and shipping multiple features or projects simultaneously

  • effectively comprehend technical details when working cross-departmentally

  • can breakdown a large and complex project into distinct and incremental deliverables

  • have excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a clear attention to detail

results.title: Director of Product Security
results.description:
Director of Product Security
Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a Director of Product Security to help develop, cultivate, and progress the security and privacy of our product services and systems.

The Director of Product Security will join the other Engineering Directors at Wikimedia who lead engineers building and operating features, products, and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to do good while improving the security, privacy, resilience, scalability, and maintainability of one of the top 15 websites in the world.

You will be leading a team responsible for ensuring and improving the security and integrity of our software systems and technical operations, including open source applications developed in house and off the shelf, with a wide variety of technologies and stack components, hosted in colocated data centers around the world and in the cloud. This position will report to the Vice President of Engineering.

This is a remote position; open to most locations in the world. Some travel required.

You are responsible for:

  • The global product security program, consisting of, but not limited to, the following domains: Application Security Engineering, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Security Incident Response, Privacy Engineering, Pen Testing, and Capabilities Management  
  • Providing strategy, leadership, staffing and budgetary requirements across a portfolio of security services in the above domains
  • Ensuring the privacy, security, and integrity of our software products
  • Leading the collaborative creation and maintenance of product and platform security policy
  • Educating staff and volunteer technical contributors in secure software engineering practices 
  • Evaluating current capabilities in conjunction with the Capabilities Management team to ensure effective security controls and countermeasures
  • Managing and developing a team of security professionals by hiring, managing performance, setting individual and team goals, and developing skills and career arcs.
  • Work with cross-functional peer groups such as Enterprise Risk, Legal, IT, Finance, Advancement, Infrastructure Foundations and others in the Foundation to define and execute:
    • Strategies for addressing security and privacy concerns;
    • Initiatives to maintain security as related to software design, development, documentation, and release; and
    • Practices to ensure the privacy, security, and integrity of data throughout the collection, access, analysis, release, and retention processes.
  • Supporting the enterprise risk function in compliance and audit for GDPR, PCI DSS, and other applicable regulations
  • Working closely with the Foundation and our volunteer community to cultivate an affirmative and proactive culture that ensures security and privacy efforts are baked into the ways we share free knowledge with the world
  • Defining and setting priorities and roadmaps for the product security and privacy teams
Skills & Experience:
  • Experience managing, establishing, creating, and deploying security and privacy efforts at a complex organization.
  • CISSP, CEH, GWEB, CASS, and/or CSSLP certification is highly desirable
  • Experience with software product security at a high traffic or high risk internet site is highly desirable
  • 5+ years of progressive management experience
  • 10+ years of applicable security practitioner experience
  • Experience with a broad range of security services and disciplines
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field or the equivalent in work experience
Qualities that are important to us:
  • Commitment to the mission of the organization, and our values
  • Commitment to our guiding principles
  • Effective at asynchronous communication 
  • Able to navigate and make decisions in circumstances with limited information
  • Solutions focus in a complex environment where resources are limited and our guiding principles are ambitious
  • Curiosity and commitment to continuous learning
  • Ability to grow and learn as a leader while growing and developing others.  
  • Desire to get results through collaboration with others rather than personal technical proficiency. 
  • Emotional intelligence, kindness, and the ability to listen, understand, and respond to multiple perspectives.

Additionally, we would love it if you have:

  • Experience with open source or open knowledge communities
  • Experience as a contributor in the Wikipedia or Wikimedia project communities
About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the nonprofit organization that operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge freely. We host Wikipedia and the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. 

The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive donations from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

As an equal opportunity employer, the Wikimedia Foundation values having a diverse workforce and continuously strives to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace. We encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate against any person based upon their race, traits historically associated with race, religion, color, national origin, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected characteristics.

If you are a qualified applicant requiring assistance or an accommodation to complete any step of the application process due to a disability, you may contact us at recruiting@wikimedia.org or +1 (415) 839-6885.

results.title: Associate Product Manager
results.description:
We’re passionate marketers, engineers, and innovators building the technology to power the future of commerce. We’re a B2B SaaS platform helping the world’s most interesting retailers and direct-to-consumer brands remove friction from the customer experience to deliver recurring revenue through subscriptions programs - shifting their consumer interactions from one-and-done transactions to long-lived, highly profitable relationships.

Recent studies show that 75% of direct-to-consumer retailers will offer subscription services by 2023. Ordergroove has created the technology that will allow retailers to do this. 

Want to be a part of it? Keep reading...

Ordergroove is a dynamic, fast-paced environment where you will be involved in building something of real value from the ground-up. We're looking for bright, talented people who are excited about innovation, growth, and the exciting world of Relationship Commerce.  If you’re motivated by a desire to solve problems and deliver groundbreaking insights and solutions you’ll fit in perfectly! We are looking for someone who has worked in the mar-tech ecosystem or subscription-based companies and can bring that expertise to Ordergroove’s client base. 

At Ordergroove, we make product and company decisions based on data. Data is what drives our ability to understand our customers' businesses and their experiences with Ordergroove so we can deliver products and features that truly help them grow. Internally, data empowers cross functional teams to help drive our own success as a company. We are committed to delivering high quality data across all of our platforms and providing key analytic metrics to our external and internal users. 

The data team at Ordergroove encompasses merchant analytics, product analytics, internal analytics and more! We are looking for an Associate Product Manager to join the data team and work across these different areas. Your job will be to make data clear, relevant, easy and accessible to those who need it so that all users, internal and external, can recognize Ordergroove's impact and make impactful decisions. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Bring data pipelines and products to life, leading initiatives from discovery to launch to understanding outcomes 
  • Own the strategic plan and roadmap for analytics delivered to our merchants 
  • Understand analytics needs and user pain points to craft product vision and solutions to address them. 
  • Determine key initiatives to guide the analytics product forward, break those plans into manageable, measurable, achievable release plans.
  • Work closely with cross functional teams such as engineering, design, success and marketing to understand and shape deliverables around data needs.
  • Identify process gaps and opportunities, take on ever-increasing responsibilities. Communicate your plans and product vision to the company. Work closely with the SVP of Product & Sr Product Manager to build a world-class analytics offering.

 

About you:

  • A passion for data and an eye for detail with numbers
  • Experience with technical or analytical product subject matter (examples include but not limited to: fintech product, analytics dashboards, internal data or technical products)
  • Ability to utilize user insights, data or analysis to inform decisions
  • Self-motivated and driven to solve problems 
  • 2+ years of experience in a software product management role, preferably a B2B software company. Experience as a developer or analyst is a plus.
  • Demonstrated success developing product vision, strategy and roadmap for a product line.
  • Willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done no matter the task, willingness to commit to a fast-paced startup working culture.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills, which can be tailored individually for a wide variety of audiences, both internal and external.

About Ordergroove:

  • Raised $50M from top-notch investors
  • Remote-first team with members all over the world and an office in NYC that allows for in-person meet-ups if desired
  • Hundreds of customers including Honest Company, IL MAKIAGE, PetSmart, Wal-mart, L’Oreal, Unilever, Peet’s Coffee, KIND, Love Wellness, and Tula

In 2000, subscriptions transformed the software world with SaaS. In 2021, subscriptions are transforming the retail and DTC world as the fastest-growing segment of commerce. 

Ordergroove’s SaaS product enables subscription experiences for hundreds of brands including The Honest Company, IL MAKIAGE, KIND Snacks, Peet's Coffee, L'Oreal, and Home Depot, shifting consumer interactions from one-and-done transactions to frictionless recurring revenue relationships. Via partnerships with leading eCommerce platforms like Shopify, Salesforce, Adobe Magento, and BigCommerce, Ordergroove's omni-channel product coupled with machine learning has processed billions of dollars in subscription volume for tens of millions of consumers.

Recently named one of the Best Companies to Work For in New York for the third year in a row, our values celebrate collaboration, different perspectives, and curiosity with the goal of getting to the right answer, no matter who came up with it. At Ordergroove we are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all people. We encourage people with different backgrounds and experiences to join our growing team so that we gain different perspectives and build the best team possible. We demand the best of ourselves and each other and never miss an opportunity to celebrate our successes.

With a fully flexible work from anywhere culture, staying connected and supporting each other are always top of mind. We build our tight-knit community through small group events like trivia night, cooking classes, and book clubs. We encourage cross-functional relationships through virtual coffees and we stay close to the business through weekly team updates and quarterly all-hands meetings.  

At Ordergroove, we focus on flexibility and empowering our team to make the right decisions for themselves. We have flexible PTO (you take vacation when you need it, not when you have earned the hours), a new work-from-anywhere policy (totally remote anywhere in the US, or you can go into the NYC office as much as you would like), and an annual personal development budget that you use for what matters to you (wellness, career development, productivity at home, etc). And of course, that is on top of the basics like competitive compensation (including stock options) and incredible, affordable benefits. Come join our amazing team while we enable the fastest-growing segment of commerce that makes life easier for millions of consumers every day!

At Ordergroove, we want to hire, develop and retain the best talent, making Ordergroove a top destination to grow your career.

The pay transparency law is a way of narrowing the gender pay gap and fostering an engaged and positive working environment.  It is also a way to share what we think is a reasonable, equitable and competitive compensation structure for the roles on our team.

The base salary for this role ranges between $110,000 and $125,000

results.title: Demand Generation Lead
results.description:
About the Opportunity
Settle is on a mission to change the way that businesses pay other businesses. Since the company’s inception in 2019, we’ve been building a cashflow management platform that allows founders and small business owners to more easily manage their company’s financial health with a mix of accounts payable and flexible financing tools. We already work with some amazing brands that you probably know and love, like Starface, Ghia, and Italic.

We’re growing quickly and looking to expand our small-but-mighty marketing team from two to three. This role will offer an exciting hands-on opportunity for a builder to lay the foundation for, and fuel our growth with digital campaigns of all types, from email to PPC and more. You’ll help deploy cross-channel campaigns in conjunction with our sales team to maximize lead generation, upsells, and ultimately conversions. As the third member of the marketing team, you’ll have a unique chance to drive the long-term direction of the org and plenty of opportunity for personal career growth as well.

How You’ll Make an Impact
- Strategize, conceptualize, and execute campaigns across digital channels
- Develop marketing hypotheses and test assumptions with quantitative analysis
- Drive measurable impact to the business through growing pipeline
- Collaborate with Product Marketing and Customer Success to automate and optimize marketing flows
- Partner closely with Sales to develop alignment needed to set the business up to hit growth targets
- Optimize targeted campaigns to drive results within distinct customer segments
- Source and manage external contractors and agencies to augment marketing efforts when needed
- Source, optimize, and implement appropriate marketing tools to deliver positive ROI to the business

What Sets You Apart
- 5+ years experience in a B2B marketing role
- Previous experience working closely with a sales org to define handoff criteria and set them up for success converting leads
- Previous experience building and executing email marketing (and drip) campaigns
- Broad experience with top of funnel — you’re comfortable with a variety of digital mediums, from email to SEO to paid search/social and beyond. You don’t need to be an expert in everything but you will have at least dabbled across channels
- Experience building and running paid digital ads on platforms like Google and LinkedIn.
- Fluent in Google Analytics (or other analytics platforms) and marketing attribution
- Prior experience with building out at least one marketing system in a previous role, and opinions about tooling/marketing stack
- Desire and ability to take calculated risks
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Great at identifying gaps and asking questions to find a solution (rather than waiting for a solution to fall into your lap)
Bonuses:
- A personal interest in DTC/CPG/Ecomm industry or fintech, or both
- Experience managing social media accounts for a brand/business
- Experience building budgets for omnichannel campaigns
- Comfortable with Salesforce
- Previous experience managing a team as well as agencies and/or freelancers

Compensation
This role has an annual starting salary range of $125,000 - $140,000 + equity + benefits. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to your individual skills and experience.

Who We Are
Settle is a FinTech company on a mission to help businesses thrive by taking the worry out of cash flow management. We’re building software making it super easy for finance teams to track, pay, and reconcile invoices. We pair that with lending products to offer our customers the power and flexibility to choose who, when, and how to pay their customers.

Our small but growing team was founded in San Francisco along with an engineering hub in Lviv, Ukraine. We’re building a fully distributed team and support you working from wherever you are. We're well funded (Series-B) with backing by Ribbit, Stripes, Kleiner Perkins, Founder’s Fund, SciFi Ventures, and others. Our benefits are competitive, our time off is flexible, and our compensation packages include equity.

Check out this Techcrunch article and Kleiner blog post.

Our Commitment to You
At Settle we know that cultivating diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment is critical to our impact and success. We create an environment where no individual is advantaged or disadvantaged because of their background. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

With a commitment to maintaining a bias-free environment in which harassment is prohibited, we respect cultural diversity and comply with the laws of the places in which we operate. We expect our business partners, suppliers, clients, and all of our team members to uphold these commitments.

results.title: Senior Artist - Studio Orbital
results.description:
We are looking for a talented senior artist who is an expert in 3D content creation. You would use your significant knowledge in games art to become the go-to person for different areas of the game’s development, including characters, creatures and organic lifeforms.

You will help mentor some amazing junior artists and will get to work collaboratively across the project to ensure amazing artwork is professionally presented and brought to life.

 

What Will You Be Doing?

  • Working with the art director to embody the artistic vision of the project.
  • Creating unique and varied content that captures charm and personality of our projects.
  • Constructing content from block-out to final in-game asset, whilst considering the framework, limitations, and design.
  • Mentoring and supporting junior members of the art team through reviews and feedback.
  • Verifying art in VR and making improvements where necessary to fit technical limitations and artistic direction.
  • Contributing to areas of the project such as plant life, creatures, products, customisations, and props.
  • Contributing to other areas of the project when possible - such as marketing artwork & 2D asset creation.

Requirements

Who Are We Looking For?

  • Experience of high and low polygon modelling, sculpting and a good knowledge of PBR material workflow via software packages such as Maya, Z-Brush, Substance, and Photoshop.
  • Knowledge of implementing art in Unreal or similar game engines.
  • Experience achieving simplistic artwork on more constrained devices (such as mobile), with an understanding of platform limitations, memory, and performance.
  • A good grasp of art and design fundamentals (including anatomy, texture, colour, and depth theories).
  • Working knowledge of industry standard project management tools and source control software.
  • A passion for video games, art, and commitment to personal development.
  • A creative thinker with strong problem-solving abilities.
  • Positive and outgoing personality with a can-do attitude and be able to adapt based on feedback.
  • A true team player, able to work collaboratively as a part of a multidiscipline team with the initiative, drive, and organisation skills to deliver excellent results on time.
  • Comfortable working in an Agile environment and responsive to change in the face of uncertainty.
  • Interest in the VR market and the latest gameplay innovations.

Benefits

Who we are

We are nDreams, an award-winning independent developer and publisher, delivering world-leading interactive VR experiences.

nDreams Studio Orbital is looking for talented people to help pioneer development in live service games for VR that will entertain players for years. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the heart of both a new team and project right from the start.

We are building a fully remote studio that holds creative diversity as a core value. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, perspectives, genders and experience levels to apply for this role.

Why nDreams?

Our growing studio shares a passion for innovation, collaboration and defining the future of VR. We encourage an open, creative, and diverse culture and empower people to explore their ideas and put their own stamp on projects. With humble beginnings of our own, we combine big projects and opportunities with a personal, caring touch. We’re proud of our culture – come and see why!

We offer some great perks, including flexible core hours, private health insurance, pension, two duvet days plus a day off to celebrate your birthday. As you’d guess, we provide all the equipment you need to create amazing VR experiences.

We are a remote first studio with the advantages that brings. We will hold social get togethers once per quarter in London to bond and become the best team we can be.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
About LeadIQ

LeadIQ makes sales teams more efficient. With our solutions you can identify and capture your prospect data, track sales triggers and compose compelling messages. Read more about us on LeadIQ.com

Overview

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our flagship product team. We are at the inflexion point for growth, and we need strong Product Managers who can help us drive forward. As a PM at LeadIQ, you should be comfortable in a hands-on, collaborative and flexible environment, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while driving towards aggressive goals to be successful in this role.

As a PM, you will direct product development and ensure high return on investment (ROI). You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow product development from start to finish. You will be a guiding force for some of the key initiatives in the product segment, driving significant growth. This is a 100% remote role and requires partnering with our diverse and distributed teams based across APAC and Europe.

 

The Role

The Product Manager will be the "owner" of our core product experience - workflow, which includes features such as automation, notifications, my Accounts, and the "glue" of our LeadIQ platform. In this role, the key focus will be to:

  • Conceptualise, launch and optimise products and features, experiment, test their performance and iterate quickly

  • Specify product requirements in a clear manner and work with engineers to deliver on specification

  • Develop product roadmaps and build alignment across product teams, cross-functional partners, and leadership team

  • Own product metrics, analysing data and reporting

  • Understanding and meeting customer needs with a knack for UX

  • Communicate seamlessly and collaborate with a cross-functional team of engineering, design, and product

 

The Person

  • 4+ years of Product Management experience, preferably in B2B segment

  • Have experience in B2B sales enterprise software or familiarity with Sales team structures and workflows

  • Proven track record of translating customer pains into product features, delivering delightful customer experiences that drive business results

  • Excellent problem-solving, organisational and analytical skills coupled with overall good communication and presentation skills

  • Highly collaborative and comfortable executing in a cross-functional, a matrix environment

  • Working experience of a high-growth startup / a similar setup will be an advantage

  • Prior work experience and/or education in Computer Science or engineering capacity; MBA or advanced degree a plus

 

About Us

LeadIQ is a Series B-funded startup headquartered in the Bay Area and Singapore. We are reshaping the future of Sales with our mission to enable the day-to-day sales prospecting workflow for every sales rep.

We are passionate about empowering our customers with Data and Insights to generate more revenue faster. We do this with the help of cutting-edge technologies and innovation.

A diverse and talented workforce powers our exponential growth across 30+ countries that breathe our core values of #EmpathyFirst, #BeBetterEveryday, #DataDriven, and #MakeItHappen, and the trust of our investors- Cathay Innovation, Fresco Capital, Strong Ventures, Eight Roads, Draper Associates, and Jason Calacanis.

We are a remote-first company with a culture of trust, independence, and collaboration striving to transform Sales. Join us!

 

LeadIQ is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, education status, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D)
results.description:
THE ROLE

remberg's mission is to help companies manage their things such as machines & equipment in the cloud and digitize associated processes in service, sales and marketing. Thereby we get rid of paper and Excel while laying the groundwork for the age of IoT. We are building the remberg XRM - a new category in SaaS that reinvents the logic of CRM by placing things at the core, not customers. We raised our EUR 11 Million Series A Round from renowned investors and business angels from five different Unicorns (including Personio, Celonis, UiPath, Forto, Aiven) and are now looking for an ambitious and talented (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D).

You like a challenging, fast-paced environment, and you have already proven in a similar position that you work independently, reliably, and in a structured manner? Then keep on reading.

Get on board in leading businesses into the digital future, help build a fast-growing start-up and set new marketing standards in the B2B world:

As (Senior) Growth Marketing Manager (F/M/D) you will be at the forefront of remberg's marketing initiatives. In this position, you will generate and convert qualified leads and ultimately fill our sales pipeline. You'll build omnichannel strategies that target key stakeholders across the entire marketing funnel, test advertising campaigns, and build a robust analytics framework to iterate and improve results constantly. You will work closely with our Head of Marketing to ensure we're aligned and hit our growth goals.

 

 

 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • You generate demand through paid advertising channels (Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.) and optimize our channels to fill the sales pipeline while supported by our dedicated Design team
  • You own the complete marketing conversion funnel, including nurturing leads and ensuring a smooth handover to Sales
  • You discover and experiment with new promotional channels to expand our target audience reach
  • You coordinate with the Sales team on current needs and launch account-based strategies to target key stakeholders across the entire funnel
  • You build a robust analytics framework to measure, test, and refine our strategies to meet our goals

 

 

YOUR PROFILE
  • 3+ years experience in Demand Gen and a track record of data-driven improvements (B2B SaaS experience is a plus)
  • Extensive proficiency in developing effective marketing campaigns and a successful track record
  • You bring experience working with Google Analytics, LinkedIn, Facebook/Instagram, Google Ads, Zapier, and Hubspot or a subset thereof 
  • Good project management skills and ability to work with multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced environment
  • You show strong ownership when managing your projects and the ability to pivot when things don't go to plan
  • You have excellent analytical skills and can quickly learn while having an impeccable eye for detail
  • You embrace feedback - no one is perfect, and neither are we. So let's make this an opportunity to praise and learn from each other
  • You are fluent in English (written and spoken, C1 level); German is a plus

We know not everyone is perfect, so if you do not meet all criteria, don't worry. We are looking forward to your application!

 

 

WHY REMBERG

The rembears are a colorful, ambitious, value-driven bunch of problem-solving champions, software-engineering masters, sales machines, customer darlings, design fanatics, product visionaries, sporting aces, beer pong kings & queens and more. In short: you should get to know us.

Apart from that, there are even more reasons to join us:

  • With remberg, you bet on the right horse - not only you but also many renowned investors believe in us, such as Earlybird, Speedinvest, Fly Ventures, as well as business angels from five different Unicorns (including Personio, Celonis, UiPath, Forto, Aiven)
  • You get the chance to help build a fast-growing startup. Many processes are still changing or are not yet as they should be. This is your opportunity to have a big impact on remberg's development and success
  • It is motivating to see that our solution helps companies in the ‘Mittelstand' to do their tasks better, easier, faster every single day and that it prepares them for the digital future
  • You can work from wherever you want, as long as you can achieve your tasks. Whatever works for you works for us (e.g. Workation, Remote, Hybrid, etc.)
  • You get 30 vacation days and up to 3 full months workation per year
  • Decide if you want Urban Sports Club membership, JobRad, GuudCard, or financial support with your mobility costs, take care of your mental health with a free nilo.health-subscription and save efficiently for your retirement with our corporate pension plan (bAV)
  • You will receive your annual personal development budget of 1,500 euros, which you can use as you wish, whether a language course, advanced training, or online courses
  • We have short decision-making processes, promising career opportunities, team events, of course, a foosball table, a very nice espresso machine, and much more

 

ABOUT US

remberg is a fast-growing start-up from Munich, building the XRM software, a new kind of solution for companies to digitize processes around 'things', such as equipment, machines, plants, and vehicles - the groundwork for the age of the Internet of Things (IoT).

results.title: Marketing Manager Americas
results.description:
Gruppo Montenegro is an international company with an Italian heart, operating in the Spirits and Food industry. We produce and commercialize premium products with strong brand equity and significant cultural relevance Amaro Montenegro, Vecchia Romagna, Select aperitivo, Bonomelli infusions, Infrè decaf tea, Cuore corn oil, Cannamela spices, Polenta Valsugana, Catarì instant pizza to mention a few.

Icons of the “Made in Italy”, our brands are the result of the constant pursuit of excellence, respect for tradition and attention to product quality and sustainability, all values that have defined Gruppo Montenegro since its foundation in 1885.

Gruppo Montenegro is an organisation committed to equality and inclusion to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for all our employees, consumers, partners, and communities. We believe an inclusive culture allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business.

Mission:

This role is responsible for overseeing a company's interactions with the public and/or relevant stakeholders by implementing social media platforms' content strategies. She/he will manage our company image in a cohesive way to achieve our marketing goals.

Responsibilities:

  • Facilitate communication between brand team and key stakeholders (or something about streamlining communication between teams and channels);
  • Collaborate on omnichannel marketing efforts - aligning content efforts across email, blog, web, social, influencer, and PR;
  • POS development and management;
  • Activation and Event Management;
  • Lead, control and track all Americas POSM executions with 100% delivery on time and with quality;
  • Generate, edit, publish and share engaging content on daily/weekly basis (e.g. original text, photos, videos and news), including Instagram, and any additional channels identified as a strategic opportunity;
  • Monitor SEO/SEM and web traffic metrics; ATL + BTL campaigns and media planning
  • Stay up-to-date with market trends, technologies and social media trends to recognize challenges and opportunities;
  • Leverage excellent presentation and story-telling skills, passion and energy to be the primary advocate for the brand internally (e.g. management presentations, sales force meetings etc.) and externally;

Requirements:

  • A highly motivated self-starter with strong passion and enthusiasm for building a global #GruppoMontenegro community;
  • BS/BA Marketing, Media and or Communications Degree;
  • 4+ years of relevant working experience working with exposure to CPG and Spirits categories;

What we offer you

  • An ambitious employer, where each employee is top of mind
  • An idea acceleration mindset, where your ideas and opinions matter
  • Flexible remote working policy
  • Career development programs to fast track your career
  • Insurance policies extendable also to family members

results.title: Director of Quality Assurance
results.description:
Sightline Payment is seeking an experienced Director of Quality Assurance to join our team to lead the Quality Assurance department, manage third party relationships and contractors, and build an automation test framework. This role reports to the SVP of the Project Management Office. You will establish good testing practices, be responsible for manual and automated testing and mentoring others with the QA team. Success in this role requires the spirit of collaboration, clear communication, and the ability to maintain a strategic focus amidst competing priorities. The ideal candidate will thrive in fast-paced, ambiguous start- up environments.

This role is offering a base salary in the range of $118,000-$130,000, depending on experience. The top end of the range will be reserved for those applicants with gaming and casino operations experience. There is the potential to earn up to an additional 20% annually in bonus. Our benefits start on the 1st of the month after the start date and include unlimited PTO, up to a 3% match on 401K contributions, paid parental leave, and a robust health benefits package.


Here is an idea of some of the day to day duties of the role:

  • Hires and trains QA staff.
  • Oversees the daily workflow and schedules of the department including the management of external third-party partnerships.
  • Evaluates external resources and solutions where applicable and makes appropriate recommendations to PMO leadership.
  • Investigate, recommend, implement, and manage automated testing platform and supporting tools.
  • Conducts performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
  • Handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy.
  • Represent the QA department to senior management and champion QA best practices in accordance to the company's SDLC processes.
  • Utilize basic statistical tools (e.g., SPC, variation, stability, control) to analyze for trends or issues.
  • Prepare any required reporting documentation for the respective testing activities.
  • Ensures test cases are traceable to originating story/requirement and those tests fully test feature requirements and/or user story acceptance criteria.
  • Drive efficiencies in the QA process and mentor other QA team members in automation
  • Collaborate with lead developers, unit testing engineer, and business analysts to develop, design and execute automated test scripts and scenarios
  • Develops, implements, and manages processes to ensure that products meet required specifications for quality, function, and reliability prior to delivery.
  • Identifies and sets appropriate quality standards and parameters for products.
  • Communicates quality standards and parameters to QA team, product development team, and other appropriate staff.
  • Orchestrates product testing processes and ensures testing environments are maintained and are simulating production.
  • Identifies and analyzes issues, bugs, defects, and other problems, particularly when problems recur in multiple products; recommends and facilitates solutions to these issues.
  • Establishes and maintains cadence with development to set testing expectations.
  • Reviews client, customer, and user feedback.
  • Maintains compliance with federal, state, local, and organizational laws, regulations, guidelines, and policies.


Here is an idea of some of the experience you'll need to have to be considered for the role:

  • 5+ years managing a QA team
  • Experience working with third party service providers and contract employees
  • College Degree in Computer Science or related field
  • Gaming or payment industry experience a plus
  • 2+ years Web and Mobile application development testing experience
  • 5+ years of experience developing test automation framework using Selenium or similar tools
  • 2+ years with API testing with Postman or GET
  • Experience with Git, Azure DevOps, Jenkins, CI/CD, Java, C#, BrowserStack
  • Highly adaptable to a changing environment
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Additional QA certifications
  • Azure Dev Ops and experience implementing and executing the Test Plans Module

Sightline Payments is the recognized industry leader in innovative cashless gaming solutions and has placed multiple programs supporting gaming verticals in the United States. Our Play+ solution offers players a truly cashless gaming experience with complete flexibility for how manage and spend their funds. We offer flexible integration choices to meet our client’s operating environment and preferred user experience, support communications with multiple gaming systems, and manage all aspects of our program from conception to ongoing program success. We are rapidly growing company that is positioned to meet the challenges of an evolving gaming ecosystem market.

Our environment is entrepreneurial and fast-paced. Individual and creative contributions to our company objectives are highly encouraged and recognized. There will be an abundance of opportunities to develop new skills and to benefit from interaction with a highly experienced leadership team.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
The Charts team at BMAT is responsible for the compilation of the official music charts for the recording industry associations in more than 30 countries. We generate these charts from the extensive reports we receive from the most popular online music services in each of the countries in which we operate.

Our mission is to build the most complete and reliable music consumption database for our clients—from record labels to music publishers and music industry associations.

Our focus for the last few years has been on growth with a lean approach, and we’ve successfully built a solid base of customers. As we grow, we continue to build out and formalise our agile product development process, so that we can keep improving our service and scaling our business.

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for turning our mission into a reality. You will work closely with our clients to understand their needs and transform them into an agile development roadmap and oversee the engineering team in charge of implementing it.

We're looking for someone with a proven track record of owning data-intensive products in agile B2B environments. Previous experience in the music business is a plus. A strong belief that music can save the world is a must.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define the product strategy and roadmap
  • Collect, manage and maintain traceability of requirements from all stakeholders across product releases
  • Set and iterate the team’s internal processes for fulfilling the product roadmap
  • Be the recognized expert in the business on the product, the market, relevant technology and the competition
  • Develop core positioning and messaging for the product

Requirements

  • Minimum of 4 years experience as a Product Manager working on software products in agile environments
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem solving
  • Technical background, with experience in web-apps
  • Excellent teamwork skills
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Willing to overlap 5h with Barcelona 9-5.
  • Experience in the music industry is a plus

Interview Process

We will start contacting candidates in January.

  • Screening call with HR (30min)
  • Interview with team manager to discuss the project (45min)
  • Take home assignment
  • Final interview (1h)

Benefits

You Can Enjoy
  • Flexible working hours and location
  • Flat hierarchy
  • You can make the role your own and run your own development
  • Online language classes to improve your Spanish, Catalan or English
  • Online and onsite courses and music industry workshops run by inhouse experts
  • We’ll provide you with all equipment needed for you to be comfortable
  • Unlimited time off because we believe that you know best when you need to rest.
  • Barcelona HQ office available to you, kitted out with a rehearsal room https://www.bmat.com/bmat-house/
Who the FAQ are BMAT

BMAT started in 2005 when a group of engineers with a passion for music decided to spin-off from an audio research lab in Barcelona. We’re now over 160 people, spread across Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Lima, Rio de Janeiro, London, Paris, New Jersey, Oslo, LA, Singapore, Tokyo, Manila, Bangkok and Lagos.

We’re a team of pretty decent people who enjoy working with each other. We’re open-minded and well-traveled, coming from all parts of the world. We’ve got rappers, producers, cello players, DJs, and songwriters. The passion for music and the excitement for innovative technology have proven to make a good combination.

We say there’s a BMAT touch. We believe it has to do with being passionate, obsessive, nice, generous, honest, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, intrepid, crazy, extraordinary, creative, agile, human, friendly, smart, witty, talented, naive, optimistic, surprising, sensual, and nerdy, but not very hipster (unfortunately). Our way of being is always sprinkled with transparency, perseverance, flexibility, open-mindedness and trustworthiness.

BMAT has grown as a company of companies. Within BMAT there are a number of products and services that developed semi autonomously for different players – Digital Service Providers, Publishers and Collective Management Organisations.

Diverse perspectives drive innovation, and innovation is kind of our thing. Our open-minded and flexible culture organically fosters this diversity. We've learnt that we thrive on learning from each other, so we don't just welcome but actively hire a range of open-minded people from all walks of life. Our team is made up of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, musical tastes, dress sense and time-zones - but we all have one common goal: Making the music world a better place. With equal opportunities for everyone, BMAT is a pretty nice place to work.

results.title: Director of Product Development
results.description:
Onebrief makes military planning seamless and represents a shift in paradigm for future military decisions. It is an all-in-one tool that supports both the creative and process-oriented aspects of military planning. In Onebrief, planners use maps, boards, diagrams, timelines, spreadsheets, slide decks and text documents to create their plans—all while sharing a common database. Everything stays in sync, in real time. Our approach has been refined and validated through hundreds of user experiments.

We’re post-revenue ($3M+ in ARR). We are backed by Y Combinator (S21) and top-tier VCs, including Caffeinated Capital (Affirm, Docker, Notion, and more). Our elite team combines the best of tech and military talent, including education and experience at Google, Adobe, MIT, Delta Force, TOPGUN, and more.

Given our current traction we can barely keep up with demand. This is an opportunity for you to join us with all the perks of a founding employee.

What you will achieve

As a Director of Product Development, your primary responsibility will be to shape our product bets before they are scheduled for implementation. Starting with opportunities identified with our leadership team, you will refine the problem definition, design a high-level solution, mitigate risks and assumption, and establish hard “no-gos,” to make sure that the project can be executed successfully with virtually no risk to schedule.

Shaped bets are rough and unfinished, but they are painstakingly thought through. All the main elements of the solution are there at the macro level and they connect together. The work isn’t specified down to individual tasks, but the overall solution is spelled out. While surprises might still happen, any open questions or rabbit holes we could see up front have been removed to reduce the project’s risk. Shaping bets involves equal parts of product, design and engineering work.

You will have the opportunity to travel and partner with military planners from around the world, empathize with their needs, and translate that into informed product bets. You will collaborate often with leadership, engineering, and design.

This is a critical position, with significant impact.

You will report directly to Rafa, our CTO and co-founder.

About You

The ideal candidates are curious and pragmatic “product people” who understand how software products are built from having done it themselves, either as software engineers or “full-stack” designers.

We are especially interested in candidates who have led product initiatives working on B2B/SaaS projects, involving aspects of creative support, data visualization, or modern collaboration.

Qualifications

  • You have been involved in the building of software products for several years

  • You have led impactful product initiatives, even if Product Manager is not your job title

  • You have a comprehensive understanding of the current state of web technologies and best practices

  • You are naturally inclined to apply a design thinking approach to problem solving, and iteratively seek to understand your users, challenge assumptions, redefine problems and create innovative solutions which you can prototype and test

  • You work effectively with designers and engineers, leading with context, setting clear expectations, and seeking pragmatic solutions

  • You have the skills to create simple solutions for complex problems quickly; often benefiting from tried-and-true techniques

  • You put user value before tech

  • You learn quickly, work iteratively and naturally seek collaboration

  • You communicate clearly and succinctly

  • You are a U.S. citizen

  • Finally, you are a manager of one—capable of setting your own direction, building something from scratch, and seeing it through

About Us

Our team shares a passion, seek excellence, and play to win, with the seriousness and camaraderie of an olympic team. We are in this together, not just because Onebrief will one day be 10x the size of Palantir. We are here to build the future of military decisions, so that the coming decades don’t repeat the previous ones.

Here’s what our team members value most about working here:

  • Founders' transparency

  • Product and vision

  • Leadership's ability to learn and adapt

  • Challenges and learning opportunities

  • Ownership and autonomy

  • No non-sense policies and procedures

  • Remote-first, as opposed to remote-friendly

What's in it for you

  • $170k - $220k salary/year

  • Equity

  • Remote work, flex time, and unlimited PTO

  • Health, dental, vision, and life insurance

  • 401k

  • Parental leave

Our Hiring Process and Compensation:

Equal Opportunity Statement

Interested? Great - we'd love to talk to you! Please apply to the role on our website https://boards.greenhouse.io/sustainlife.

Who we are:

Sustain.Life is a high-energy early-stage Climate Tech start-up that focuses on providing ESG solutions to our customers to support their ambitions to address the most challenging questions of our time. Our sustainability platform specializes in B2B solutions for corporate sustainability efforts, offering innovative technology solutions and industry experience to support business targets, personal goals and a vision of a sustainable future for everybody on the planet. We are building a team that will help our users launch sustainability programs,, benchmark their ESG performance, measure carbon emissions, set meaningful goals, execute reduction strategies, and ultimately share their progress with key stakeholders. We are on a mission to create best-in-class software that changes the world.

Join us in our mission! We are a fully remote workforce collaborating across US, UK and Ireland. We have an incredible team of world-class experts, designers and technologists developing our sustainability platform, and we were finalists in the 2022 SXSW. We believe in our mission, and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us and help us grow.

At Sustain.Life, we take our mission seriously. In 2021, our entire carbon footprint was only 120 Metric Tons of carbon, which we offset on behalf of our employees. Our platform helps us understand our impact on the environment and to take the necessary steps to reduce that impact.

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Description: 

Shift5 is seeking a full-time Product Manager, with a specific focus on our DoD customers, to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll have an opportunity to make an immediate impact on real world operations and problems we’re solving for our customers. You’ll learn about capability gaps in existing defense platforms, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build the product infrastructure to support our goals. Your primary responsibilities will be to act as the voice of the customer while supporting our product vision and strategy.

We are looking for someone who thrives while working in partnership with engineers, designers, and other stakeholders. The ability to translate complex technical scenarios into simplified stories and requirements is absolutely essential for this role. We operate in a fast-paced environment with competing and evolving priorities and you’ll be expected to do the same. The ideal candidate for this position is someone who is comfortable living in ambiguity and can self prioritize and self direct daily tasks and requirements. If this sounds like you, drop us a line because we’d love to hear from you.

Shift5 is a rapidly growing data and cybersecurity scale-up. We specialize in capturing and analyzing serial bus data in real time, providing anomaly detection and operational intelligence required to act. Our insights provide real-time alerting and historical trends to assure mission readiness and cyber survivability, and our innovative technology enables military systems to deter adversaries, protect warfighters, and maintain their competitive edge. We are a collaborative, passionate and driven cadre of cyber security experts. Our engineers are multidisciplinary, and our team is dynamic. We’re a growing company focused on helping our customer’s fleets run smarter and safer by capitalizing on mountains of data resting right about the wheels. Come join us.

In this role you will be expected to:

  • Identify, explore and learn about gaps in defense capabilities, engage with customers and users, synthesize and analyze feedback, and build a product infrastructure to support our goals
  • Define solutions
  • Identify and define potential features that will accelerate Shift5’s goals
  • Set clear outcomes for your area of responsibility in partnership with  engineering, design and other key stakeholders
  • Effectively communicate product vision and strategy
  • Proactively communicate goals to stakeholders and manage delivery expectations
  • Work hands-on to deliver new capabilities across the lifecycle of the product, from initial release and implementation, through up-keep and day to day improvements
  • Collaborate with Sales and Marketing to communicate product capabilities to customers and other key stakeholders

We're looking for someone who is/has:

  • BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or you’re technically savvy enough to ask engineers good questions about architecture decisions and understand the answers
  • 3+ years experience implementing and/or supporting software development or enterprise network capabilities, with specific experience in a hands-on product management role
  • Demonstrated ability to work with internal and external stakeholders across a wide range of technical comfort
  • Demonstrated experience turning conflicting or incomplete ideas into concrete action plans
  • At least a baseline understanding and experience working with DoD platforms and systems, experience within DoD fleet maintenance is a plus
  • Experience and understanding of non standard network serial protocols such as MIL STD-1553, J-1939, CANBUS and/or ARINC 429, is a huge plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
  • US Citizenship
  • Active (or ability to hold/obtain) a US Government Top Secret security clearance

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Competitive salary and stock options in a fast-growing startup
  • Employer-paid medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their families
  • Health Savings Account with annual employer contributions
  • 401k with employer contributions
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance
  • Uncapped paid time off policy
  • Flexible work & remote work policy
  • Tax-deferred public transit benefits with Metro SmartBenefits (DC/MD/VA)

We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that embraces the diversity of our people and represents the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems. We strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work. 

Shift5 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, projected veteran status, or any other protected group or class.

results.title: Field Marketing Manager
results.description:
Acquia is the open digital experience company. We provide the world's most ambitious brands with products built around Drupal to allow them to embrace innovation and create customer moments that matter. At Acquia, we believe in the power of community and collaboration — giving our customers and partners the freedom to build tomorrow on their terms.

Headquartered in the U.S., we have been named one of North America’s fastest growing software companies by Deloitte and Inc. Magazine, rated a leader by the analyst community, and named one of the Best Places to Work by the Boston Business Journal. We are Acquia. We are building for the future and we want you to be a part of it!

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Field Marketing Manager to support our sales team in North America. As a Field Marketing Manager, you will be part of an entrepreneurial team in a rapidly growing business with your role in marketing focused on driving enterprise pipeline growth. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, development of field marketing strategies and plans, event management and execution, partner co-marketing, pipeline acceleration initiatives, and adaptation of lead generation campaigns targeted at the Enterprise and Mid-Market size businesses and the Public Sector.. 

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with the ability to produce high-quality results. Proficiency in effective cross-functional communication coupled with a results-oriented mindset is key. Candidate must also be flexible and have the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and able to handle multiple projects with tight deadlines. A strong B2B marketing background in IT with a focus on measurement and accountability are key success factors.

Job Requirements:
  • Craft overall marketing strategy in collaboration with Sales leaders and Marketing to deliver leads and accelerate pipeline growth targeted on new logo creation.
  • Drive new and creative lead generation activities including events (virtual/hybrid/in-person), direct marketing, webinars, collateral and customer case studies.
  • Develop account based marketing plans leveraging market and customer data and analytics to identify who to target, where and how.
  • Collaborate closely with the channel team to integrate partners into field marketing opportunities.
  • Track and analyze the efficiency of our marketing campaigns to determine ROI and prioritize resources.
  • Lead all aspects of budget, metrics and marketing spend ROI.

Desired Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 5 years experience in a digitally-led B2B marketing role.
  • Experience of developing marketing programs for enterprise targets.
  • Ability to demonstrate marketing impact on bookings via account based marketing plans.
  • Prior experience in high technology/enterprise software in a field marketing role is required.
  • Ability to craft great collateral and structure and write compelling marketing copy for campaigns.
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to earn trust and respect from sales management.
  • Experience with sales operations, reporting, marketing & campaign dashboards and KPIs.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders in a fast moving environment.
  • Willingness to travel.

Acquia is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Interested residents of Colorado may contact NA-recruiting@acquia.com as it relates to regulation C.R.S. § 8-5-201. Information regarding benefits are linked here.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
SUMMARY

As a Product Owner in our Client Delivery team you will define, prioritize, and evaluate the work based on Client requirements for new implementations, change requests and maintenance upgrades to optimize the business value delivered by your scrum team. You will work with subject matter experts at our customers and within Vestmark to develop the user stories for product enhancements and oversee product enhancements throughout the development lifecycle.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*

  • Participate in discovery alongside key stakeholders ensuring a significant understanding of requirements to share with the development team.
  • Partner with Products to understand new features
  • Coordinate, facilitate and/or conduct as needed demonstrations
  • Manage Change Request assignments with the scrum team and ascertain priority and timing expectations with the client/RM
  • Manage upgrades and maintenance releases with scrum team
  • Work with internal/external client teams to document business requirements
  • Write internal/external user stories and acceptance criteria and conduct walkthroughs as needed
  • Refine user stories with the scrum team
  • Establish priorities, collaborating with client or internal relationship managers when needed
  • Prioritize interruptions against sprint work
  • Maintain scrum team backlog
  • Creating & Maintaining epics for projects
  • Owning the status of an epic and ensuring they are closed when work is complete
  • Strive to have 1-3 future sprints planned
  • Work with scrum master to resolve impediments preventing team from meeting sprint goals
  • Be available for adhoc questions raised by the scrum team
  • Testing on adhoc basis as needed

PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES

  • Experience: 3+ years’ experience as a Product Owner or Business Analyst with knowledge of Agile process and principles
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Financial industry knowledge, particularly in the areas of portfolio management, portfolio accounting, or trading operations
  • Familiarity with the data associated with the processing of securities, transactions, and positions of either retail or institutional portfolios
  • Experience with software delivery
  • Enterprise software company experience or experience in a professional services organization delivering enterprise software used by financial services organizations
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Strong and effective customer service skills
  • Bright with a high degree of initiative to learn and work collaboratively to solve problems
  • Do what it takes attitude, displaying positive energy even in challenging situations
  • Strong communication skills; able to respond and exchange ideas clearly and effectively through writing, speaking, and presentations; shares appropriate information to keep people informed

COMPETENCIES

  • Teamwork – We before me-- Puts needs of team first and aspires to bring out the best in others; collaborative, empathetic and humble; values the opinions of others; assists others when needed; participates effectively as member of a team; balances personal contributions and needs with those of other members of the team to achieve common objectives.
  • Knowledge Explorer – Creative problem solver and adapts to challenges at hand using creative collaboration; curious, proactive and resourceful; able to incorporate other viewpoints as part of the process of developing solutions
  • Positive Energy – Ability to address difficult situations with humor and sense of opportunity; approachable, constructive and engaged
  • Own It- Empathetic and accountable until the end.

WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS

  • Willingness to travel occasionally on as needed basis. 

BENEFITS

  • Vestmark pays 90% of Medical and Dental insurance premium
  • Vestmark sponsored Life, STD, and LTD Benefits
  • Generous PTO
  • Company equity in the form of Restricted Stock Units
  • 401(k) with Employer Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program

 

Vestmark is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Vestmark prohibits employment discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability status, protected military or veteran status, and genetic information.

This role cannot be performed by a resident of New York City, NY.
